channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Use of locally made test kits suspended
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The use of GenAmplify rapid testing kits for the coronavirus disease 2019 has been suspended due to a contamination issue on the raw materials used in their manufacture, Science and Technology Secretary Fortunato dela Peña announced yesterday.

item.title: Jeepney drivers eyed as contact tracers
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Officials are discussing the possibility of tapping jeepney drivers as contact tracers while they are not yet allowed to resume operations because of quarantine restrictions, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Deadline eyed on health workers’ benefit distribution
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte may impose a deadline on the giving of compensation to families of health workers who died on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: ABS-CBN’s Lopez confirms dual citizenship
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: ABS-CBN executive Eugenio “Gabby” Lopez III yesterday confirmed that he has dual citizenship.

item.title: Senate approves Bayanihan Act 2
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Senate last night approved on second reading a bill replacing Republic Act 11469 or the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act which gave President Duterte special powers to address the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: Philippines targets higher-spending tourists
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: The Philippines will be targeting higher-spending tourists as it moves forward under a new normal.

item.title: DepEd seeks more funds for ‘blended’ learning
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Education officials have asked lawmakers to increase the budget of the education sector to support programs to be implemented in response to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Protesting is not terrorism – DND
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana assured the people yesterday that protesters are not terrorists as he allayed fears over the controversial anti-terror bill now awaiting President Duterte’s signature.

item.title: Senators still want VFA review
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Senators yesterday welcomed Malacañang’s move to suspend the termination of the Visiting Forces Agreement between the Philippines and the United States, but still pressed for a review of the military pact.

item.title: Domestic commercial flights back
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: Beginning June 5, domestic flights from the Ninoy Aquino International Airport will resume as Metro Manila transitions to a more relaxed general community quarantine amid the coronavirus pandemic.
